data.title: Hitting the Road in 2020
authors: The National Board for Respiratory Care

data.meta_site_name: The National Board for Respiratory Care -
data.text:
Our ongoing efforts to positively promote and advance the respiratory care profession will keep NBRC President Katherine L. Fedor, MBA, RRT, RRT-NPS, CPFT, NBRC CEO Lori M. Tinkler, MBA, and various staff on the road in 2020. Taking advantage of opportunities to meet and speak with leaders in respiratory care as well as interacting with state societies, respiratory therapists, students, educators, and physicians at industry meetings and conferences around the country allows us to elevate our profession.

Here’s a look at where we’ll be the first half of 2020:

February 28, Georgia Society for Respiratory Care – 2020 Winter Forum, Atlanta GA

March 12-14, The National Association for Medical Direction of Respiratory Care – NAMDRC 2020 Annual Conference, Scottsdale, AZ

March 12, CANCELED Maryland/District of Columbia Society for Respiratory Care – Partners in Respiratory Care Excellence Symposium, Salisbury, MD

April 2, CANCELED Michigan Society for Respiratory Care – 2020 Spring Conference, Ann Arbor, MI

April 16, RESCHEDULED Kansas Respiratory Care Society – 43rd Annual State Education Seminar, Manhattan, KS

April 17, RESCHEDULED Alabama Society for Respiratory Care – 2020 Annual Meeting, Orange Beach, AL

May 15-20, CANCELED American Thoracic Society – ATS 2020, Philadelphia, PA

June 25, RESCHEDULED Texas Society for Respiratory Care – 49th Annual State Convention and Exhibition, Arlington, TX

July 13-15, CANCELED American Association for Respiratory Care – AARC Summer Forum 2020, Snowbird, UT

Click the event to learn more. As always, we are excited to listen, learn, and share our NBRC news. We’d love to see you and hope you have a chance to join us at one of these events.
